title: Sri Lanka plans price formula for fuel, electricity: Minister
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka will introduce a price formula for fuel and cost based pricing for electricity, Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera has said.
“We will introduce a price formula for fuel,” he told parliament on Tuesday in his maiden address after being made minister a day earlier.
At midnight on Monday fuel prices petrol Octane 92 to 338 rupees a litre, Standard Diesel to 288 rupees.
Wijesekera said reduced to 1,627 million rupees a day to 327 million rupees after the price hike.
In a twitter.com message he said cost based pricing for electricity is being planned.
Cost based pricing for fuel is likely to be structural benchmarks or prior action. (Colombo/Apr19/2022)
